text:
Affordable noodles but below average quality.

The fish ball was soft and not spongy.
Each bowl of soup came with 2 slices of tender pork and a little minced pork. Fried fish stick didn't add any texture.

Was browsing around when I came across this shop.  Saw a couple of folks eating so I decided to give it a try.  I am fan of mee kia dry noodles and eating the ah Lim mee pok and art of mee pok at Simpang Bedok raises my expectations of this dish.
I was pleasantly surprised at the dish.  The noodles were well prepared, though I believe I should have ordered the mee pok if I expected more bite in the noodles.  Well blend of sauce,chilli, vinegar and fried garlic.  What was most impressive however was the mince pork and think pork slices. I usually ask hawkers not to include the pork slices as I don‚Äôt really like the texture and smell, but this was surprisingly tender and fresh!  The soup had a nice herbal taste to it !  I‚Äôd dare say the soup trumps the 2 stalls i mentioned above.
Super recommended üëç
Would have given them a 5 star if the fishball was better.

Just a surprise finding. The soup is the star here, it tastes like pig organ soup to me but have other ingredients like fried beancurd skins, very tender pork slices and fishballs. Chilli is not spicy, add chilli padi to boost the level.
One of the best fish soup I have ever tasted! A small little coffee shop stall but the taste is delicious and they were super generous with their food portions!

From the first time when they started the stall here, from good to terrible now, they have skimp on ingredients, change to worse suppliers and now even the taste is slowing changing worse. Now you even skimp on the sauce of the dry mee. Tasteless! Only one thing has increase from that constantly, the price. Other than that, food quality, ingredients, standard has all degraded. This is my first time giving them feedback here and also my last time patronising their stall. Its fine to increase price as needed but your food standard has also deteriorate continuously throughout the years, thats very saddening! But I dont think the boss cares anyway.
